final_report.root_cause: The geo service container (hotel-reserv-geo) failed during startup because it could not reach its MongoDB backend and panicked. The immediate cause is a configuration mismatch: the geo process attempts to connect to mongodb-geo:27777 (observed in startup logs) while the in-cluster mongodb-geo Service/pod is listening on the standard MongoDB port 27017. Additionally, the geo pod manifest contains no environment variables/ConfigMap/Secret or command-line flags to override the DB endpoint, so the application used an incorrect default and could not connect. This connection failure ('no reachable servers') triggered a panic (exit code 2) and repeated container restarts (CrashLoopBackOff).
final_report.evidence_summary: 1) Pod geo-6b4b89b5f5-frdwz shows CrashLoopBackOff, RestartCount=8, LastState Terminated Exit Code 2. 2) geo container logs show it reads DB URL 'mongodb-geo:27777', attempts DB initialization, logs 'no reachable servers', then panics with stack trace at main.initializeDatabase (cmd/geo/db.go:26). 3) geo pod spec contains only JAEGER_SAMPLE_RATIO env var and command ["geo"] — no DB host/port envs, envFrom, ConfigMap/Secret, or flags to set the Mongo endpoint. 4) mongodb-geo Service exists and maps to a running mongodb-geo pod exposing port 27017. 5) There is no evidence of node-level or image issues; failure is at application-level DB connectivity caused by the endpoint/port mismatch and missing override.
final_report.investigation_summary: Priority-1 investigation retrieved pod description and logs for geo-6b4b89b5f5-frdwz: observed Exit Code 2 and panic on DB init ('no reachable servers'). Priority-2 investigation inspected the geo pod spec and the mongodb-geo Service/pod: geo's manifest has no DB configuration to point it to the in-cluster Mongo, and the Service/pod are healthy on port 27017. Correlating logs and manifests shows geo attempted to contact mongodb-geo on port 27777 (wrong port) and had no configuration to correct that, causing the connection failure and subsequent CrashLoopBackOff.
